intro: Cynorkis oblonga, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a compact rosette of leaves. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are pollinated by insects. Cynorkis oblonga is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
